title: 111_hr1137
content: The "Athletic Trainers' Equal Access to Medicare Act of 2009" amends the Social Security Act to include education and credentialing requirements for physical medicine and rehabilitation services provided incident to a physician. It also covers certified athletic trainer services under Part B of the Medicare program. The "Athletic Trainers' Equal Access to Medicare Act of 2009" includes certified athletic trainer services in Medicare Part B coverage. The term 'certified athletic trainer services' refers to services provided by a certified athletic trainer under a physician's supervision, authorized by state law, and covered under Medicare Part B for individuals under a physician's care with a prescribed plan. The term 'certified athletic trainer' refers to an individual licensed or certified in a state that provides for licensure or possesses a qualifying degree and has passed a national certification exam. The amendment allows for payment of certified athletic trainer services under Medicare, with payment amounts set at 80 percent of the actual charge or fee schedule amount. Payment for athletic trainer services will be made to the physician, clinic, or hospital that employs the athletic trainer involved. Athletic trainer services are included in the therapy cap and athletic trainers are recognized as practitioners for assignment.
